trans:
Can a person sentenced to imprisonment for having sexual relations with someone under 18 years old have their prison sentence postponed if they are seriously ill?
According to Article 67 of the 2015 Criminal Code, the postponement of the execution of a prison sentence is regulated as follows:
Postponement of the execution of a prison sentence
1. A person sentenced to imprisonment may have their sentence postponed in the situations below:
a) If they are seriously ill, the sentence may be postponed until their health is restored;
b) If the person is pregnant or is nursing a child under 36 months old, the sentence may be postponed until the child reaches 36 months old;
c) If the person is the only breadwinner of their family, and if they serve the prison sentence, the family will face particular difficulties, the sentence may be postponed for up to 1 year, except in situations where the person is convicted of crimes against national security or other very serious crimes, or especially serious crimes."
